translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Yasas
Yasatthera’s Birth Story
“On the great ocean,
my dwelling is well-constructed,
The well-constructed lotus pond,
with the sound of geese and peacocks.
Covered with coral trees,
and with lotuses and water lilies;
And a river flows there,
with a good ford, delightful.
Covered with fish and turtles,
with various kinds of birds;
With the loud cries of peacocks and geese,
and the beautiful sounds of cuckoos and others.
Partridges, peacocks, and geese,
geese and peacocks that live in the river;
Partridges and sparrows here,
fireflies and jīvaṁjīvaka birds.
With the cries of geese and peacocks,
and many brown and tawny birds;
Endowed with the seven treasures,
with jewels, pearls, and coral.
All the trees are made of gold,
with various branches and foliage;
Shining day and night,
the dwelling is always beautiful.
Sixty thousand serving women,
depart in the morning and evening;
Sixteen thousand serving women,
always attend on me.
Departing from the dwelling,
to Sumedha, the Leader of the World;
With a clear and joyful mind,
I worshipped that one of great glory.
Having paid homage to the Sambuddha,

analyzed: annam pānam paṭṭhapetvā  kālam ārocayim aha  vasī sata sahassehi
translated: Having prepared food and drink,🔽I announced the time;🔽The leader of the world,
with a hundred thousand attendants, approached.
With five-part musical instruments,
I made a welcoming procession;
On a seat made entirely of gold,
the best of men sat down.
There was a canopy above,
made entirely of gold at that time;
A fan was waved
to the unsurpassed Saṅgha of monks.
With abundant food and drink,
I made offerings to the Sangha of monks;
At the two pairs of Independent Buddhas,
I made offerings to the Sangha of monks.
What the wise one said,
the receiver of offerings,
Sitting in the Sangha of monks,
he spoke these verses.
‘He who with food and drink,
made offerings to me and all of these;
I will praise him,
listen to me as I speak.
For eighteen-hundred eons,
he will delight in the world of the gods;
A thousand times he will be a King,
a King who rules by Dhamma.

analyzed: upagacchati yam yoni  devattam atha mānusa
translated: Whatever womb he will enter,
whether divine or human,
he will carry a covering made of all gold.
For thirty-thousand eons,
born into the Okkāka family,
with the name of Gotama,
he will be a Teacher in the world.
He will be an heir to his (father’s) Dhamma,
a Dhamma-image from his chest,
having fully understood all the pollutants,
he will be extinguished without pollutants.
Sitting in the Sangha of monks,
he will roar his lion’s roar;🔽they will carry a parasol over him on the funeral pyre,
below the umbrella.
I have attained the ascetic life,
I have burnt up the defilements.
In a pavilion or at the foot of a tree,
I have no fear.
For twenty-one thousand eons,
the gift I gave then,
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of all gifts.
The defilements have been burnt up by me,
all existences have been destroyed.
Like an elephant who has broken his bonds,
I live without pollutants.
Welcome indeed it was for me
in the presence of the Buddha.
The three knowledges have been attained,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.
The four analytical insights,
and the eight liberations,
the six super-knowledges have been realized,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”
